membership:
The European Association of Co-operative Banks is a member of: 
- European Banking Industry Committee (EBIC) 
- European Payments Council (EPC) 
- European Financial Reporting Advisory Group (EFRAG) 
- Co-operatives Europe
goals__remit:
Founded in 1970, the European Association of Co-operative Banks (EACB) is the voice of co-operative banks in Europe. As such it represents, promotes and defends the common interests of its 28 member organisations and co-operative banks at large and acts as their representative organ vis-à-vis the European Union’s institutions and governing bodies. 
 
To that end and according to its statute,  the association performs among others, the following activities:  
 
- informs members on the evolution of legislation and regulatory initiatives affecting the sector; 
- provides a platform for members to exchange experiences and points of view and coordinates their positions with regard to common issues; 
- voices the common positions towards the European bodies 
- prepares position papers on issues of common interest 
 
Moreover the EACB is also responsible for: 
- strengthening cooperation between European cooperative banking groups; 
- promoting and developing the cooperative principle in the banking sector at international level and, more generally, in collaboration with other representative cooperative organisations. 
 
Co-operative banks form decentralised networks which are governed by banking as well as co-operative legislation. The co-operative banks business model is based on three pillars: democracy, transparency and proximity. With 58.000 outlets and 3.135 banks, co-operative banks are widely represented throughout the enlarged European Union playing a major role in the financial and economic system. In other words, in Europe one out of two banks is a co-operative. Co-operative banks have a long tradition in serving 209 million customers, mainly consumers, retailers and SMEs. Quantitatively co-operative banks in Europe represent about 80,5 million members, 732,000 employees with a total average market share of about 20%. 
 
For more info, please visit our website: www.eacb.coop
